channel.title: Laurie Hawn
channel.description: Recent news about Laurie Hawn, from openparliament.ca.

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: #Canada still leading G7 with most stable financial system. Over 59,000 new jobs in August. Stay the course. #cdnpoli

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: @pmharper showing leadership at #G20, pushing others to follow our lead to balanced budgets and lower debt-to-GDP ratios. #cdnpoli

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Guide at Kandahar Memorial was WO Andre Vachon, member of 1992 William Tell Team Canada that I led. Small world. http://t.co/y4NCsgycdh

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: With RCAF Captain Cutts and #German tourist Albert Rathjen at Kandahar Memorial. #Ottawa #RCAF #CAF http://t.co/qIBPaeuZeB

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Saw this memorial grow over 7 trips to Kandahar. Very sad, but intense pride at the same time. #lestweforget http://t.co/yGQl9UO8oi

item.title: Posted on Twitter
item.description: Visited Kandahar Afghanistan Memorial in Hall of Honour. Very moving. #cdnpoli #Ottawa http://t.co/FUrINWmR1L

item.title: Mentioned by Xtra.ca
item.description:
Federal trans bill passes third reading
Conservative MPs who voted in favour of the bill included John Baird, Laurie Hawn and Shelly Glover. The bill will now go to the Senate. Liberal leadership candidate Justin Trudeau did not attend the vote. ... Liberal MP Hedy Fry voted in favour of the bill and says the step forward for human rights reminds her of the occasions when her party added sexual orientation to the Human Rights Act and passed same-sex marriage. “Important historic moments in Parliament make it worthwhile,” she says. Trans athlete Kristen ...
